Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE
Name: Udjat-eye
Description: This small oval plaque in faience carries a double decoration. The recto shows the udjat-eye, that is to say the eye of Horus given a prophylatic force coming from the magic of Thoth. The verso represents the image of Bes, also a symbol of protection. The two sides of the plaque are surrounded by a fluted border.
